content.question:
<math alttext="2 S O 2 gas plus O 2 gas react to produce 2 S O 3 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="delta S naught equals negative 187 joules per mole of reaction kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mn>187</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.20em"></mspace><mtext>J/</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>(mol</mtext></mrow><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></mrow></msub><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

Substance 
Approximate <math alttext="S naught in joules per mole kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>(J/(mol</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K))</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="S O 2 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 
? 

<math alttext="O 2 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 
205 

<math alttext="S O 3 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 
257 

The reaction between <math alttext="S O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="O 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is represented by the chemical equation above. The table provides the approximate absolute entropies, <math alttext="S naught " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for <math alttext="O 2 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="S O 3 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following mathematical expressions can be used to correctly calculate <math alttext="S naught " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="S O 2 gas" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>SO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>(</mtext><mi>g</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="S naught equals the negative of open bracket, negative 187 minus 257 plus 205, close bracket, joules per mole kelvin" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>°</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>−</mo><mtext>[</mtext><mo>−</mo><mrow><mrow><mn>187</mn></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>257</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>205</mn><mtext>]</mtext><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>J/</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><mtext>mol</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>K</mtext></mrow><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
